Instruction: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place a silicone baking mat on a baking sheet.

Combine water, butter, and salt in a pot and bring to a simmer. Lower the heat to medium and whisk in the flour until a paste-like dough forms, about 2 to 3 minutes. Move the dough to a bowl and let it cool until warm, around 5 to 10 minutes.

Whisk in 1 egg, thyme, and black pepper into the cooled dough until the egg is fully blended. Add the remaining egg and continue whisking until it’s completely mixed into the dough. Fold in 3/4 of the cheese until well incorporated. Using a scoop, place 1-inch balls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet and sprinkle the tops with the remaining cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden and puffed.
